name: tdarr
description: Tdarr is a distributed, self-hosted video transcoding and library optimization platform. It uses plugins, workers, and rules to automatically transcode, scan, and clean up media libraries via a powerful web UI.
features: Distributed transcoding: Distribute transcoding workload across multiple worker nodes for faster processing.
Plugin system: Use community plugins or create custom ones to define transcoding rules and workflows.
Library scanning: Automatically scan media libraries to identify files that need transcoding or optimization.
Codec conversion: Convert videos between codecs like H.264, H.265, AV1 for compatibility or space savings.
Health checks: Scan media files for corruption, missing audio tracks, or other issues requiring attention.
Conditional rules: Apply transcoding rules based on file properties like codec, resolution, bitrate, or container.
Hardware acceleration: Leverage GPU acceleration for faster transcoding using NVENC, QuickSync, or VAAPI.
Queue management: Monitor and control transcoding queues with priority settings and manual intervention options.
Statistics dashboard: View transcoding progress, space saved, and processing statistics in a comprehensive dashboard.
File organization: Automatically organize and rename files after transcoding based on customizable patterns.
Staging system: Test transcoding rules on sample files before applying them to entire libraries.
Notification system: Receive alerts when transcoding jobs complete, fail, or require attention.
